Mathematics.title: Algebra Basics
Mathematics.content: Algebra involves using letters to represent numbers and forming equations to solve problems.

Mathematics.title: Quadratic Equations
Mathematics.content: Quadratic equations are of the form axÂ² + bx + c = 0. They can be solved by factoring or the quadratic formula.

Biology.title: Cell Structure
Biology.content: Cells are the basic units of life containing organelles such as the nucleus, mitochondria, and cytoplasm.

Biology.title: Photosynthesis
Biology.content: Photosynthesis is the process where plants use sunlight to make food from carbon dioxide and water.

History.title: World War II Overview
History.content: World War II was a global conflict from 1939 to 1945 involving most of the world's nations.

History.title: Ancient Civilizations
History.content: Ancient civilizations like Mesopotamia, Egypt, and the Indus Valley laid the foundations for modern society.

Chemistry.title: Periodic Table Basics
Chemistry.content: The periodic table organizes elements based on their atomic number and properties.

Chemistry.title: Chemical Bonding
Chemistry.content: Chemical bonding involves the interaction between atoms to form molecules through ionic or covalent bonds.
